author: 0xd4d
body:
# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
# Windows OS with .NET Core SDK installed and in the path
donet
donet.exe
```

# Expected behavior

`dotnet.exe` (or `dotnet`) should be suggested when you try to execute `donet`

# Actual behavior

No mention of `dotnet.exe`

```
PS C:\> donet
donet : The term 'donet' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
At line:1 char:1
+ donet
+ ~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (donet:String) [], CommandNotFoundException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : CommandNotFoundException


Suggestion [4,General]: The most similar commands are: del, move, sort, mount, dnsn, set, select, dir, popd, copy.
PS C:\> donet.exe
donet.exe : The term 'donet.exe' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
At line:1 char:1
+ donet.exe
+ ~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (donet.exe:String) [], CommandNotFoundException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : CommandNotFoundException


Suggestion [4,General]: The most similar commands are: dotnet.exe, net.exe, consent.exe, convert.exe, doskey.exe, net1.exe, reset.exe, sort.exe, connect.exe.
PS C:\>
```

# Environment data

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-preview.4
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-preview.4
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18362
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
title: PSCommandNotFoundSuggestion doesn't check external applications unless you add .exe to the command
